description: Low-cost digital temperature and humidity sensor featuring a capacitive humidity sensor and a thermistor. Operates on 3–5 V, uses a single digital pin for data output, and includes a 10 kΩ pull‑up resistor on the data line.

other: 10 kΩ pull‑up resistor recommended on data line

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to 3.3–5 V, GND to ground, Data to a digital pin with a 10 kΩ pull‑up to VCC. Pin 3 is unused. Use a microcontroller that can handle microsecond timing (e.g., Arduino, CircuitPython).

example_code.explaination: Arduino sketch that initializes the DHT22, reads humidity and temperature, and prints the values to the serial monitor every 2 seconds.

source_document: DHT11, DHT22 and AM2302 Sensors – Adafruit tutorial (https://learn.adafruit.com/dht)
